Patrick Massot said:

Why did I think that Anatole or Benjamin already computed that integral? Did they give up?

I did do it in a slightly convoluted manner in https://github.com/ADedecker/gauss using parametric integrals, but that was before you did the proper version so I was using an epsilon-delta version that I just translated from a course without thinking about generalizations (and oh god does that proof looks horrible). This was the motivation for all the "improper integral" stuff I did at the beginning of last summer (which was arguably way harder than it should've been because it was the first time I heard of the dominated convergence theorem), but I've never really tried to update the proof using the mathlib theorem for derivation of parametric integrals. But anyway, I think it's better to have this straightforward version, and it's a good test case for the change of variable API
Ok, I'm happy to read that Covid isn't making me imagine things that didn't happen.
I made PR #15114 where I add the convolution to both yaml files and add a probability section to the overview.yaml. Additions/changes are welcome!
